list_definition.definition: a person’s signature, especially as a souvenir

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She collected autographs of film stars.

list_definition.definition: to write one’s name on (especially for a souvenir)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The actor autographed a photo for her.

list_ex_of_english: She not only travelled the road down to the coal face but, when at the coal face, signed autographs for half an hour.
The four finalists arrived on the back of convertible cars and signed autographs.
Block asked only that the offending bat be autographed and given to her.
He answered more mail than other band members, and often added messages to his autographs.
He turned down honours and awards offered to him, and refused to give interviews or autographs.
The event attracted 3,000 teenagers, mostly girls, who met the group and obtained autographs.
Many items are autographed by the expedition members who wrote them.
Hamasaki persisted on signing autographs despite her staff urging her to leave; thus she kept signing autographs as she walked.
